Joint Resolution of Illinois General Assembly to Abraham Lincoln, 19 February 18491 Resolved by theHouse of Representatives, theSenateconcurring herein, that our Senators inCongressbe instructed and our representatives be requested to use all honorable exertions

to procure the passage of an act to direct the Secretary of War to select a suitable

tract of Lands upon theIsland of Rock Islandin the State ofIllinoisfor the site of the necessary buildings for a Marine Hospital with the necessary

grounds and directing a sale of the remainder of the Land upon said Island in small

quantities at public sale. The proceeds of said sale to be appropriated to the establishment

and support of said Marine Hospital; and that theGovernorbe requested to forward a copy of this resolution to our Senators and representatives

in Congress.2

footnotes.text:
1On December 21, 1848, theIowa General Assemblyadopted a memorial requesting theU.S. Congressto establish a marine hospital on Rock Island.  On January 6, 1849, GovernorAugustus C. Frenchpresented the memorial to theIllinois House of Representatives.  The House referred the memorial to the Committee on Federal Relations.  The Committee
                  on Federal Relations reported back the memorial on January 11 with this resolution,
                  which the House adopted.    On January 18, theSenateconcurred.Iowa HouseJournal. 1849. 2nd G. A., 248, 261, 266, 277, 339; 
                     Illinois HouseJournal. 1849.  16th G. A., 43, 70, 130; Illinois SenateJournal. 1849. 16th G. A., 62, 100; “Report of the Committee on Federal Relations, Upon a
                     Memorial of the Iowa Legislature in Regard to a Marine Hospital Upon the Island of
                     Rock Island,”Reports Made to the Fifteenth General Assembly of the State of Illinois(Springfield: Charles H. Lanphier, 1849), 87-88.

2On February 5, 1849,Stephen A. Douglasintroduced this resolution in theU.S. Senate.  The Senate referred the resolution to the Committee on Commerce and ordered it
                  printed.   On February 19,Abraham Lincolnintroduced the resolution in theU.S. House, and the House tabled it and ordered it printed.  On February 17, the Senate Committee
                  on Commerce reported back the resolution with  a bill to authorize a section of Rock
                  Island set aside for a Marine Hospital.    The bill reached a second reading, but
                  went no further.U.S. SenateJournal. 1849. 30th Congress, 2nd sess., 180, 226; U.S. HouseJournal. 1849. 30th Congress, 2nd sess., 474.
